history.content:
Technically yes since you're employed/working then, but in reality (at least in my experience) you do not actually have to be on campus until classes start (or you have orientation, or your specific class needs you there, or whatever). 

Regarding the paperwork, I think they're more strict on actually getting that in by August 1 though (last year I had to go to Berkeley specifically over the summer to get that in on time, but that wasn't necessarily the case previously).

I just got offered a TA position for Fall 2019, and in the email it said "You are expected to be on campus and complete all hiring paperwork by August 1, 2019". Is that saying that you have to be on campus on August 1, and everyday until instruction begins, or just that you need to have your paperwork in by August 1? I know there is ASE orientation and a teaching conference that I need to attend, but other than those, will I need to be on campus before classes actually begin? Any input is much appreciated!
history.subject: Question about TA timeline before instruction begins
